website_summaries.verdict: Despite its small size, this sturdy quad copter performs nearly as well as its larger and pricier competitors.
pros: Stands out for its stable flights and lightweight yet durable frame
cons: Instruction manual could be more detailed

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little guy in June of 2015, and flew it mostly inside "walking the dog" and amusing the cat. On July 4th I took it outside at a friend's house and lost it over a fence. In trying to climb the fence I hit the throttle losing it forever to the either, or so I thought. This spring my friend had his 2nd story roof inspected and found my little hubsan. After a quick clean with a dry tooth brush the thing flys like new, even after a harsh rainy and icy winter. Well made. Five stars. #don't drink and drone. PS I spray painted the safety ring red and white to better orient myself.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis H

customer_reviews.title: the camera on it is to be expected and is a pretty good quality
customer_reviews.text: I am changing my review of this recently purchased quad. The motor burned out and I have only flown it like 5 (not even full batteries ) disappointed with this one. For the price you can’t beat this mini quad copter, the camera on it is to be expected and is a pretty good quality. This is my third Hubsan H107c 1) lost in high altitude (120+ft) & high wind. 2) tree in my front yard in high wind. So I won’t be flying this one in high wind! It’s fun and powerful as many other reviewers have said, it sounds like a swarm of bees. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Get it.
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. This is my first drone purchase and I must say that it is great for beginners. Only took a few flights to get used to the controls. Very durable as it does take some beatings. Check the bottom of the plastic case it comes in for the propeller guard as I almost threw it away with the box. Make sure you get a few propellers and extra batteries along with a multi charger to keep your flight time going. I've flown several other drones since this one and I must say that this is a great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Snag

customer_reviews.title: Flies surprisingly well for such a small quad.  Great video even though only .3mp version!  Very light, don't fly in a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: This thing flies surprisingly well for such a small quad! My son loves it! The video recording on it was also FAR better than I expected, considering I didn't realize that it was the .3mp version. One warning, however, is that you should not fly this when there is much breeze at all, especially around trees, as he lost this one evening just before dark, over the trees near our home. The wind caught it a bit, and it got out of range quickly, then disappeared. We have not found it. I felt bad for him, so I bought a replacement, but got the 2mp version. Will review that separately and comment on video on that, too.
customer_reviews.author: VTstuff C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a learner!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first quad. It is a blast to fly. I like the extra weight from the camera because I have better control outside than my buddies that don't have cameras. I'm a horrible pilot. With that being said, I have beat this thing up and only had to replace the guard and some props. The "legs" have "crumple zones" that help minimize impacts so that is a nice feature for an amateur like me. The camera works well so far. The power button is a bit difficult for someone with size 11 fingers to push, but it is manageable. The time stamp on the video files always starts at 1/1/1980 12:00AM, but I'm not concerned with that.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P

customer_reviews.title: Love this little thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing. It's my first dive into quadcopters. The thing is a tank! While learning how to fly, i've crashed into just about everything and the thing keeps on going. The default mode goes a long way to keeping things in order for new pilots. I use this mode to even let me fly safely indoors. The expert mode really allows the advanced flyers show their skills doing flips and quick direction changes. I like how a prop guard is included into the packaging. The camera on it isn't that great unfortunately. The flashing indicator lights are a good feature allowing me to know when the battery is almost drained.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Logan

customer_reviews.title: Certainly the best indoor RC helicopter out there for the price
customer_reviews.text: Certainly the best indoor RC helicopter out there for the price. The stability is unbelievable and the control is very easy. You get wild very fast with this toy. The responsiveness is mind blowing. I have been playing with RC helicopter for many year now and this quad is a blast. Perfectly adapted for young kids. The only issue is that eventually dad and kid fight for who is flying it. Well built, sturdy with the crash proof guard. Make sure to buy some spare blades, they will break eventually. The video quality is decent, very dependent on the light quality and exposure but honestly the fun here is all about flying.
customer_reviews.author: Stephane

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy, but buy extra batteries and props.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun indoor drone. It is way to light if any kind of wind is present. The flight time is very short, so buy extra batteries. The manufacturer tells you that you have install the propellers in a certain order. However, while the propellers are stamped on the back--they are impossible to read without some type of magnification. Also the propellers tend to pop off when you crash and are impossible to find--buy extras. It is a good drone for my grandchild to learn on.
customer_reviews.author: Buster

customer_reviews.title: My experience with this was negative. I am an ...
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this was negative. I am an experienced quad flyer. On the first mission, the Hubsan landed too hard and it broke an arm. The arm on my other Hubsan broke as well. This is a weakness in design and it a major drawback to this otherwise well built toy. My other complaint about this model is that the SD card ejected after only one use - I never saw video from it. The second card was ejected after the first landing as well. I did find the card but I have lost interest in this unit. You may want to tape the card into place as it will pop out as sure as I am writing this.
customer_reviews.author: Solar Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For A Beginner
customer_reviews.text: Was nervous about the price but was happily surprised. This isn't anything major but great for someone just wanting to have a little fun around the yard. Was a Christmas gift for my husband and he loved it! You don't have much control over it once it goes out of range (which is to be expected). He learned that the hard way, lost it in the woods within 24 hours but we ordered a new on that same day. You can purchase a crash kit separately and I do recommend it. Also a good idea to order extra batteries, it seems to only last about ten minutes on a full charge. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy G.

customer_reviews.title: I can't tell you how much I like this aircraft
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how much I like this aircraft. It was the first drone I bought and ended up being the right choice. It is extremely easy to fly for its size, it's inexpensive, parts are cheap too. I highly recommend this drone as an entry level purchase, not too big or too small. The camera is average but I hardly ever use that. BTW, much better to fly this indoors as opposed to outside.= at least until you get some experience with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ed C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Fly Without It !!!
customer_reviews.text: Actually it is one tough little quad. In the hands of a beginner, without an instructor (lots of flights with this make of quad), you will REALLY need the blade protectors. The manufacturers of quads should include them in their pricing. Unless you are good with a solder iron, order two quads to start with. Great little machines but the smaller they are, the quicker they maneuver, and they don't have GPS stabilization like the DJI quads. Of course they don't cost as much either. My second is on order and patience will win out. HA
customer_reviews.author: GGG

customer_reviews.title: Best-flying model in the Hubsan lineup (basic camera)
customer_reviews.text: Best model in the Hubsan lineup (if you don't need camera quality). More powerful than the 107L. Need to give attention to the motors and arms after every crash. Can use between 240 and about 500 mah batteries (slim). Beware- Newer upgraded "H107C+" models are really horrible!!! Newer models try to maintain altitude and do it terribly, sometimes just flying away while you're asking them to come back down. Stick with this discontinued one.
customer_reviews.author: bb2012sg

customer_reviews.title: This drone looks awesome and fun and was on the very first use ...
customer_reviews.text: This drone looks awesome and fun and was on the very first use out of the box. However, the controller never seemed to work right. Either that or the motor has very little power. The entire unit will get only a foot height and then turn off. We thought it was possibly because the remote didn’t have a good signal.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli HTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners and/or enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner drone. It's easy to just fly around the house, especially with vaulted ceilings. Battery life leaves a little to be desired, but I picked up a 5 pack and solved the problem easy enough. Very sturdy. I have had some "rough landings" and at most, the propellers pop off and the guard gets a little loose. No visible damage. Haven't used the camera so no feedback on that, but the rest I would highly recommend. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor BTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Great drone!
customer_reviews.text: Really great drone for the price! It has a really easy set up and also its really easy to fly! All the necessary information is in the manual, and you can easily find videos on the internet to help you with any issues. The battery life is considerably small, but that's because of the size of the drone, I highly recommend buying some extra batteries to enjoy the drone even more. I also recommend buying the protection ring as I did and as I show in the pictures attached, THE PROTECTION RING IS NOT INCLUDED.
customer_reviews.author: Fabricio Trentini

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. It is a great toy for someone to learn on. Puts up with a decent amount of beating up and slamming into trees etc. The servo posts have a limited break away allowing for better impacts and less chance of actual damage. This was purchased for a new teen but I had plenty of hours pulling tricks with it my self. If you are the more impatient type, I would recommend a couple extra battery and/or the gang charger. Fly time is very limited to help keep the weight of the unit down.
customer_reviews.author: ravenest13

customer_reviews.title: Took a soaking and still flying!
customer_reviews.text: Fun little drone. Very responsive, nice set of controls and adjustments available..... AND... mine landed on a store roof. It was there for a week during some torrential rains (up to 10 inches rain).... After a couple of dry, windy days, we got up there and retrieved it. It was dried out by then, I charged up the battery, and it worked right away and it has been flying great ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Allen L.

customer_reviews.title: Little bit of fun !
customer_reviews.text: This is a great indoor flyer and can handle outdoor flights as well. It is super fast and fun ! Flight home is around 7 mins and it has multiple modes to fly in . It also has an auto flip function when in expert mode ! Well built and quality design make this a must to any fleet ... I've actually purchased two more ! Get extra batterie specifically from the drone pit stop as they add more time and fit much better !
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Have fun!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few of these and they are lots of fun indoors and out. Good way to practice before spending a ton on larger drones. The noise is high pitched door to the small props. This thing is quite durable. Just remember, don't let out get too far away from you. The wind Will try and take it! The remote range is outstanding. I recommend using the prop guard always. It's taped to the bottom of the insert.
customer_reviews.author: JonnyBinKY

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer, don't forget to order the prop guard and 500mAh batteries!
customer_reviews.text: great little trainer to get you ready for the big boys. The micro-sd card slot could be of higher quality, but it works. Just make sure you check to make sure the card is seated properly after a hard landing. Documentation is typical for a Chinese product, steps out of order, etc, but you can figure it out. Make sure you get a prob guard and extra props, as you will use a few learning to fly it. The little bit of extra weight with the prop guard adds more stability, as will the upgraded 500mAh LiPo batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Points

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept but lacked in quality .
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that my son loved this . It went pretty much out of our visual sight . I really can move and go very high in the air . He had no issues maneuvering this at all . The downside was that is was very flimsy and the quality just wasn't there . It broke within a day and it took for ever to replace the parts . We actually replaced them more than once . Honestly , if you're going to buy one of these . Spend the money and buy a big one that is better made .
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Fun mini-Quad!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun little quad. Maybe 6"x6" it fits nicely in the palm of my hand. I'd recommend getting some extra props or the prop guards with it, as if you are not familiar with flying you will go through some props quickly. The camera is OK, though with my flying it is like watching the Blair Witch Project (bounces around a lot). It is a lot of fun to fly though, and is pretty fast as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bowerman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: While the instructions are a bit confusing as many Chinese products are, the heli works perfectly. It has a bit of a learning curve, but that is expected. Mine came with a protective piece. Without that piece in place, I would have destroyed many blades. This thing even works outside with moderate wind and that really says something. It is a blast to fly. The camera works OK, but I have not used it much as I am concentrating on improving my control technique. I don't think anyone would be disappointed with this little quad.
customer_reviews.author: KE5RI

customer_reviews.title: For the price you really can not go wrong here
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, an inexpensive flying machine with a video camera that is relatively easy to learn, cheap to fix and intensely fun to use. I was incredibly surprised with the quality of the video it produces. Flew it up next to a dragon fly and saw it cruising along in the video! Pick up two, one for your friend or your child and one for yourself and prepare for a good time. Just remember to invest in a few extra batteries and some crash packs.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is definitely worth the price . . . this is a great quadcopter to learn to fly on before purchasing a more expensive drone. I highly recommend buying the Hubsan crash pack (about $11 on Amazon) as it comes with extra propellers, 2 motors, 2 LEDs, extra feet, and a replacement copter body for your quadcopter. If I had to complain about anything it would be the camera - it's about the same quality as the camera on most laptops and does not record audio.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Great drone for beginner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a raffle prize for a school function, but my son had to try it out first, making sure the batteries and SD card were correctly installed. It worked fabulously. Yes, the image is slightly grainy, but for $40, this is a great, great item! My favorite part is the rubbery bottom that resists damage during crash landings. Pre-teen kids can definitely handle this -- if their parents give them the chance! :)
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: Battery solder joint comes loose after about 45 days of semi-consistent use.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased three of these and on two of them, the solder joint that attached the battery to the copter came loose. I would say it was my son's fault (he's only 8 years old), but I did the same thing to mine (I'm 41, haha). Only a 30 day return policy as opposed to Amazon's normal 60 day policy (it happened after 45 days of use).
customer_reviews.author: Gordo

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid, great value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quadcopter, worked perfectly right out of the box. It might be small, but it flies "big". Very stable, tracks and hovers very well after some minor trim. Bright LEDs, almost hurts to look directly at them. I find this quadcopter much better than a traditional hell for fine tuning your "nose-in" skills, much less intimidating yet still develops the same reflexes. A QC this good was not available on the market 3 years ago at 5x the price. I recommend without reservations.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: I love it.... The dog hates it.
customer_reviews.text: For the money.... This is the best drone you can buy. If you're looking to learn how to fly, you need to try this one out. I have 7-8 drones now and this one was a great starter for my son to get proficient enough so he doesn't break the $500 ones. It's big enough a mild wind doesn't blow it around, but it's small enough to fly it in the house and chase the dog around.
customer_reviews.author: Slomo

customer_reviews.title: Still figuring it out!
customer_reviews.text: Lone the looks and compact size. Love that there are many how-Tos on YouTube (seems popular). Hard to use, though. Had to buy several extra battery as the one that went with it has a 10-minute range. Also still not fully flying.
customer_reviews.author: Jop

customer_reviews.title: I love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy! The pictures are OK. Flies great. It sure pissed off the neighbors dog though. Light and easy to use. Don't fly it inside the house you might get it stuck in your wives hair and she might get really mad at you. Stuff happens. Smoother and quieter than the one I built "Big Dick", of course it is 30 times smaller and a lot lighter and doesn't have laser targeting and GPS but just the same it is a great starter drone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am a rookie pilot. This is my first Quad. After some research and a $30 Amazon Card at my disposal, this is what I decided to get. Great Quad with tons of customizations and nuances! This is more than enough for me as a beginner and I am sure is still awesome for professionals. Order as many batteries and chargers as possible because 6 minutes goes quickly. Outside over grass with low winds makes for "the best" practice. Inside is fun as well but be sure to get a couple of packs of propeller blades as you will lose them frequently. Because of this Quad my sons and I will be hobbyist for life.
customer_reviews.author: Burlwin Oldnam

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and addictive little thing ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for someone, and they love it. It takes some practice to get used to flying this very responsive little beast. You certainly need the propeller guard, as crashes will be inevitable. The provided battery lasts 5 - 10 minutes per flight, so you should also consider getting additional batteries for longer sessions of flying. I only knocked one star off for the battery life. The price is quite reasonable, too. We will have to wait and see about reliability and longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Ukesocrazy

customer_reviews.title: Cute little thing but maybe best for indoor use only
customer_reviews.text: Had some trouble getting it up and going. Hard to control when outside. Might be better used indoor only or only on days with no breeze. Took it up outside about 8 days after we got it, wind caught it and we lost it in the field. It's so small we couldn't find it again. I wish there was a locator button. Oh well, it was okay while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: enjoying this quad.. i don't think there is much left original on it after a month of crashing and learning.. but parts are cheap and it's a part of the gig.... now i'm to the point i don't crash unless i'm trying some stunt flying in the house.. i don't think i would have been so hard on it if it wasn't too cold to fly outside ...needless to say i really enjoy it and as soon as it gets warmer i'm getting the 107d and taking both out flying.....
customer_reviews.author: Skully

customer_reviews.title: Great copter, but not for beginers.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great micro quad copter. I have multiple larger ones that I have no problem flying. This one however is very hard to fly, I have broken it many time. Lucky for me, repairs to the copter are easy and cheap. I would recommend you buy a crash kit for this if you get one. This easily clear 500 feet in seconds when you put it on full throttle. It is so powerful it is unbelievable. No videos on the internet do a justice to how powerful it is.
customer_reviews.author: Klabick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect training tool for larger quadcopters!
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking of getting a large quadcopter (i.e. DJI), this is the perfect little drone to practice with. It responds quickly to controller commands and is much more stable than other models I have tried. The motors are also more powerful. Battery life is approximately 6 minutes with 380 mAh batteries. I would recommend this product. Only drawback is low resolution camera. I have considered removing the camera to add flight time.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M

customer_reviews.title: Great Quad
customer_reviews.text: Pro's - This is a great flying quad. I have had this one for over 5 months and it is still flying great. Con's - The camera has very poor quality. I only used it a couple of time them removed it to lighten the quad. This was my first quad and I have loved flying it. I fly mostly indoors but have flown it a few times outdoors. It has taken a lot of abuse and still working. It even survived a crash into the deep end of a swimming pool.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The little drones work well. I bought 2 for some nephews of mine. I took it out and flew it for awhile to verify they worked which they did. I gave the controller to my dad and went to the bathroom. 2 minutes later, he flew it off into the valley never to be seen again. Haha. Lesson is to not fly too far away from you. Good product though so I bought another for the nephew.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great starter drone
customer_reviews.text: Great drone to learn the basics. I specifically purchased this drone to practice flying before buying a more expensive one. Highly recommend buying extra batteries and a mute-port charger. Less down time if you can change out batteries without waiting for one to charge. Lots of info out there with ideas to modify and further protect the body. For instance gluing foam ear plugs to the feet so as to cushion landings a bit while you learn.
customer_reviews.author: Icarus

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, stable flying, and video recording is nice!
customer_reviews.text: Mini coper was easy to setup, is well made, and hovers very well. The automatic stabilization is nice, and easy to control. The unit holds a charge for about a 5 minute flight which is decent for the size. Recently added an SD card to record the video which is a little klutzy to operate, but after a few attempts works fine. Also it is nice that the unit comes with a blade protector helping avoid breaking blades in the event of a crash. Overall have been very pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Bauer

customer_reviews.title: not a whole lot of stability while playing outside and inside it boosts up very quick and not easily controlled causing damage
customer_reviews.text: this drone is alright...not a whole lot of stability while playing outside and inside it boosts up very quick and not easily controlled causing damage. I was forced to buy replacement parts kit within 2 days of buying this because everything on this is soft plastic and breaks easily and wiring to motors strip easily while replacing the blades. over priced for what it is. I suggest looking other options
customer_reviews.author: rakee.sam

customer_reviews.title: My son has really enjoyed this quad
customer_reviews.text: My son has really enjoyed this quad. The video quality is much better than we expected and it's fun to watch the flight from the quad's perspective. (You do need to buy an SD card for it though.) The parts do break easily on hard landings or when it is flown into a wall or other obstacle so I would recommend getting spare parts which can be found on Amazon also.
customer_reviews.author: Louise H

customer_reviews.title: Steep learning curve.  It's also about the size of your fist.
customer_reviews.text: It might be me but the instructions don't make a lot of sense. So I went to YouTube video's to learn how to fly this. SO far that hasn't helped either. It's like they have a different machine. I'll keep trying, but for now my inability to make the toy slowly fly around the room is bugging me. I keep hitting the popcorn ceiling, which showers the area with little white particles. My living room has dandruff.
customer_reviews.author: Wiggly Toes

customer_reviews.title: Insanely awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first quadcopter. I can't believe how powerful it is. You should try it to believe it. It is also very stable than helicopter. The video quality is good too. I didn't read through the manual, I didn't know how to turn it around or spin it, I just learnt it from another review. Use the left stick left and right to spin, haven't tried it yet. I couldn't figure out how to put the protective ring, yet. This is kinda like a quick review out of excitement.
customer_reviews.author: ganesh usha

customer_reviews.title: Pay more to get a better drone.
customer_reviews.text: I could never get this trimmed correctly I even had a long time drone pooled try his hand he gave up and so have I.
customer_reviews.author: LRHall

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. Very sturdy and just enough noise from the motors. Very sensitive in response in my opinion. The initial calibration was easy for one mode but a little tricky to get the 2nd mode functional. Managed to fly it around indoors and outside (flew it into the neighbors yard) I recommend getting the protective guard around the propellors as I knocked mine a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Nana EC

customer_reviews.title: Great Quadcopter - Totally worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the first quadcopter I've flown and it was super easy to get the hang of. One issue was I messed up the prop placement after I put on the guard and didn't realize it. It caused a little bit of a headache because I thought it was a calibration issue till my buddy figured out the props were out of order. Haven't checked the video quality yet but for $60 I'm not expecting much.
customer_reviews.author: G. McDermid

customer_reviews.title: My son really liked it but the instructions are poorly written and confusing
customer_reviews.text: My son really liked it but the instructions are poorly written and confusing. We still haven't got the trim set just right. The propellers pop off pretty easy but the replacements were affordable so I ordered a bunch. It is fun but a little disappointing in how difficult it is to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota M Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I have crashed this more times than I can count, replaced two motors and used up dozens of props, and it keeps going. Don't know why so many others were having such problems, this is one of the best learning quads you can get, a perfect starter. It does take some tweaking to get to hover, it has no FPV and the camera is pathetic, but for a starter it's spot on.
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: My kids and I have such a great time pulling this mini hubsan drone out in the ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I have such a great time pulling this mini hubsan drone out in the most random places and taking it out for a spin. It's a little tough to learn on at first due to its small size, but it is strong as can be and fly's through the air just fine. If you can learn to handle this little drone, you will be able to fly any drone afterwards!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Robert

customer_reviews.title: Really entertaining toy for kids 12-14 or with a parents supervision.  Buy from USA seller for fastest shipping time.
customer_reviews.text: Really cool toy, bought as a gift. We had it flying in no time without reading the instructions. Can't wait to fly it outside. -Mine needed batteries for the remote. -Mine came with a spare set of props and a prop guard -Watch who you buy it from, if they don't give an address they are probably from China. Not a bad thing, but shipping could be months long.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Enthusiast Guy

customer_reviews.title: A blast, well worth $25
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is great. It can do some serious maneuvers for such a little guy. Flight time is not great, but battery charges fairly quickly. Comes with some extra rotors, but you might want to get some more as well, because it seems fairly easy to lose them when they fall off in a crash. A lot of fun, and a great gateway quad copter.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: but after a few crashes I learned to take it slow and easy. Propeller guard is in bottom of packaging
customer_reviews.text: 1st time flyer, but after a few crashes I learned to take it slow and easy. Propeller guard is in bottom of packaging. Buy a crash kit and lots of props. Get a set of 5 Tenergy batteries for $20 on Amazon Prime as battery only last a few minutes and takes 50 minutes to recharge. Most kits come from China, so a long time coming. I purchased 4 replacement motors with 2 day shipping from Aerobotic Solutions for $18 after it got away from me and crashed through a bunch of trees, yep, I have over $100 in my new toy. Good learning toy.
customer_reviews.author: mike moore

customer_reviews.title: it takes like 4-10 tries to get it and the remote to ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been having a few problems with this little helicopter. I've had a few crashes with it. Who doesn't? But after a while, or after even a small crash, it takes like 4-10 tries to get it and the remote to pair. Maybe mine is just faulty, which is bad luck for me, but oh well. Still fun to fly. Instructions aren't too specific on how to flip. I learned that the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Reil

customer_reviews.title: Still works after a year!
customer_reviews.text: This was a christmas present a year ago now, and it's still in one piece, and plenty of fun. It's definitely more challenging than some of the newer more expensive units with built in corrections, but there's also a sense of accomplishment when you succeed in a nice long flight with this one.
customer_reviews.author: P. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: My first Hubson..
customer_reviews.text: Great little drone, but you probably will want to know how to fly without Altitude Hold though.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Love it, I fly in windy conditions and its more fun.
customer_reviews.text: I love it, it flies very nice. The video looks shaky but its a cool feature and a lot of fun. It flies really far and high and behaves great even in windy conditions but fly in in expert mode even if you are a beginner, novice mode is not the best, its very durable it can take a beating and keeps flying get the crash pack and a few extra batteries and you are set. I really love it .
customer_reviews.author: gianni

customer_reviews.title: fast and fun
customer_reviews.text: Great fun to fly. very responsive. Buy extra props, you will need them. I had one motor get a bad spot where it would not start. I think the motors could fail if the prop is stuck against something when you try to take off. The remote had bad segments in the display 1 minute after after I first started it. Not a big deal since I don't look at it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: henryspl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is amazing! And when I say little, I mean it! I knew it was going to be small, but it was smaller than I imagined. It doesn't effect my thoughts about this copter at all though. It is super snappy, and has a very good experience when flying. The camera is actually quite good too. It takes some time to learn how to fly, but this is an amazing product to learn to fly!
customer_reviews.author: A.Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few weeks of play
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a gift and it was really fun for about two weeks before one of the little engines died. Before that though it was loads of fun to fly! The little camera isn't the bad and it was fun to make videos for the kids to watch. It was easy to control. It only flys abou 5-6 minutes before the battery has to be charged again.
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: Great, fun toy
customer_reviews.text: Great, fun toy, but terrible to callibrate - drifts all the time. Be very careful flying this indoors - I hit the ceiling, the TV etc. Treat it for what it is - a fun toy. Video function hasn't worked yet for me - perhaps due to the poor quality micro SD card that I bought. Good idea to buy a protective ring for the propellers, extra batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Any help would be great!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get it off the ground, the propellers are on correctly; A matching A and B matching B. The controller doesn't hold a charge and we have yet to see it fly. Any help would be great!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Taylorson

customer_reviews.title: love the drone but the video recorder will not work
customer_reviews.text: love the drone but the video recorder will not work. I have followed all direction provided and searched all forms for fixes with no luck. Wish It did, I would really like to take some videos. but its still a lot of fun without the recording capabilities. has anyone else had this issue and found a way to fix it?
customer_reviews.author: blinkerfocus

customer_reviews.title: Durable is this drones middle name
customer_reviews.text: This quad can really take a beating. I purchased it to learn on before i build my FPV drone, and let me tell you I really suck! This thing has smashed into everything in my house and it just keeps on trucking. I recommend picking up some extra batteries, a multi battery charger, and more blades. I have not broken a single blade once, but I have had some fly off during crashes so unless you want to move the fridge every time you crash in the kitchen your going to need extra blades.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Learning Curve - take it slow!
customer_reviews.text: Regarding the negative reviews, there is a learning curve and "beginner" should be taken with a grain of salt. This little drone will push through 30mph gusts or more and take a beating at the same time. Start Low and Slow, and be sure to use the prop guard - also, use the u-wrench to remove the props without bending the motor shaft. My only complaint is the inability to disassemble completely without first desoldering the propellers. Disregard the negative reviews, they're just newbs who don't like a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: I did crash this thing multiple times the only thing that would break on it were propellers and they are pretty much expected to
customer_reviews.text: I flew this thing about 300 ft into the air and I lost it when it crash landed. I did crash this thing multiple times the only thing that would break on it were propellers and they are pretty much expected to break in a crash so buy propellers! This is a very nice quadcopter and I bought a replacement because of how much I liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: who would have thought such a small drone could be as fun, powerful and easy to fly
customer_reviews.text: Wow, who would have thought such a small drone could be as fun, powerful and easy to fly? I have several Phantom-series quadcopters for more serious flying yet when you want to fly "under the radar" (avoid negative comments, safety concerns) and fly on the cheap, this is THE COPTER to buy - reliable, too!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Nistler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic toy that is perfect for beginners all the way up to the very experienced. I still have not used the camera feature on this, however I can speak to the great build quality, durability and fun.....ness. Originally bought it for my kid and found myself fighting for the chance to play with it. So, I bought myself one!
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Good product, takes time to learn to fly
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift. It's a good unit, but complicated to fly. We both agree that if the controls were simpler, it'd get 4 stars. FYI, the module is very sturdy. After many crashes (or as he refers to it, "smashing into a wall"), only once did a rotor pop off, & it was easy to put back on.
customer_reviews.author: AkITgal

customer_reviews.title: but great fun to fly thru the house
customer_reviews.text: Not a big drone, but great fun to fly thru the house! The props are protected so when you slam into the ceiling, walls, floors ... or whatever, they don't break and you can start over. If I had any complaints, the battery is short lived, but the high shrill it puts off makes me glad that it is ,,, so I'm good!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Ann Rasco

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast!!! I have quads that have brushless motors and very fast. For the size and price of this thing i am amazed. The camera isn't the best but this thing handles great and the speed is sick. I have the non camera version x4 and this one has bigger motors to carry the camera.
customer_reviews.author: 😊

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny it'll put a smile on anyone's face
customer_reviews.text: I've spent a lot of money on little drones here and there over the years and this one is probably the best value I have found for the money, pretty decent battery life, it's fun to fly and durable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: If you want to get into flying... Hands down get this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe how well this flys. Such a great value. Flys better than my $400 drone. Don't have to worry too much about broken parts because it's so small & light. A new motor for my other drone is $50. I got this instead and love it way more!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TStix

customer_reviews.title: awesome lil bugger
customer_reviews.text: i have a small army of the hubsan x4 series- I prefer this model due to the larger motors- do yourself a favor and buy the .3mp unit instead of the 2mp unit, strip the video cam and you'll have a lil quadrocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Johns

customer_reviews.title: Fun first Quadcopter
customer_reviews.text: This is my first quadcopter. This little thing really goes. Radio range seems a little short (<100 feet) but it is too small to be able to see it at distance anyway. The controller sensitivity adjustments and youtube videos helped me get started flying. Pretty strong in the wind. Short flight times so get more batteries to enjoy flying. Get one now for lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Antrim

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AWESOME! Have never had any serious RC helicopters/quad rotors ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! Have never had any serious RC helicopters/quad rotors and was a bit nervous getting this one but it was super easy to set up and fly. If you get one of these make sure you order extra battery's and props right off he bat. You will need them! The only thing I wish it had is audio for the camera. Will be buying more of these for the kids!
customer_reviews.author: John Fallin

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first drone/quadchopter and I am so happy with it. There are two huge pieces of advice that I would like to share and that is to get the rotary blade guard with it and to go on YouTube and watch the tutorials on how to use the settings menu on the controller and lower the sensitivity when you first use it. Then change it as you progressively become more used to the drone. Hope this review helps!
customer_reviews.author: John H. Feeney

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay, I Guess
customer_reviews.text: My first drone, so hard for me to compare. It seems to be pretty good quality for the price. It's been pretty hard to learn how to fly it and land it softly. Smaller than I thought. The battery doesn't last very long before it has to be recharged. It's held up well to some of my hard landings.
customer_reviews.author: KY Home Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fun budget quadcopter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter drone, or otherwise cheap option. My two complaints are the flight time is pretty short and the charge time is EXTREMELY long. I get maybe 10 minutes of flight and it takes about 45 minutes or so to charge back up. Kind of kills the buzz at that point. The other problem I have is the propellers fly off a little too easy, but I guess that's better than breaking off.
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Loved it while I had it
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while I had it. Fun little helie to fly. Video was not too bad, not HD, but not bad. Flew it above the tree line on a calm day and discovered a wind that took it for a ride deep into the woods. was not able to locate it before the battery died. It's somewhere north of the cabin, if you find it, let me know.
customer_reviews.author: C Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: For the price and for the size you can't beat this thing. It seems to fly very stable, and for my first quad it wasn't all that hard to fly. Flying it around with the camera on is also a lot of fun. I'd recommend another battery and the blade guards. Also buy more blades, they are very durable, but crashing is bound to happen. The unit itself is very durable, I've crashed it from many, many feet up and it always survives. I've had to take it apart a few times to put the plastic back together under the blades, but it snaps in pretty easily. Must buy for this price!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: this thing is awesome!! Be careful though
customer_reviews.text: Yo, this thing is awesome!! Be careful though, taking it outdoors takes care, cause the wind will take it. However, this little drone is super durable. The first time I went outside, it shot up like 100 feet and onto my work's roof. I was able to still control it, but the wind took it again and it flew another 100 feet and crashed to the concrete parking lot. I got back in range and it still worked without a hitch. Great quality!! The concrete will split the rotors though, so be careful. But that was my own fault. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: mike williams

customer_reviews.title: Preferred to the Syma x5, especially for indoor flight
customer_reviews.text: Great quad, I have flown both the syma x11 and the x5, this one is my favorite. From other only reviews the x5 seems to be it's closest competition, but this one is much more stable and agile. The size difference is huge between the two, so if you're looking for something for indoor flight, go with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great starter quad
customer_reviews.text: This is the exact same as the Hubsan H107L but this one has a camera. Great starter quad, extremely quick and responsive. I have had it more than 400 feet away without any connection issues. Batteries last 6-7 minutes. Be sure to get a crash pack ,extra batteries, and a charger that can charge more than one battery at a time. Great fun, small enough to run inside as well. Do yourself a favor and pick one of these up.
customer_reviews.author: Corey J

customer_reviews.title: Get Some!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for this product. Although the instructions are not ideal, like why to select a mode (choose mode 1), this little intro copter his amazing for the price. However, save some $ for extra batteries, a multi charger and a repair kit. Also, this unit comes with a blade guard, check the bottom of the packaging when you take it out of the box. Oh, 0.3mp camera weak, but the 2.0 mp if you care for quality images. I went minimalistic for this first time buy.
customer_reviews.author: Red Rooster

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Drone!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little guy for my boyfriend for Christmas, as he loves anything RC that flies...This is his first drone, and has spent some time learning to fly it. It didn't arrive in time for Christmas, but that was my fault for ordering it too late. It is fast! My boyfriend has had a blast with it, Definitely get extra parts, and battery when you order it. The little drone is capable of surviving some serious crash landings, but the propellers are a bit more fragile than the body of the drone...Over all, this is a great starter drone, and being that it is so small, you don't have to worry about registering it! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice to fly around the house, if the wife lets you.
customer_reviews.author: motorcycle 724

customer_reviews.title: I need better accuracy. Lol
customer_reviews.text: So I buy a hubsan x4 (H107c). Great little gadget. I got three flights out of it. A week after that a tree ate it up.smh! Only thing left now is the remote.
customer_reviews.author: ilisha thompson

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the dog or the cat catch it
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for this product I had fun flying this in the backyard and in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mike AF

customer_reviews.title: ubsan X4 (H107C) 4 Channel 2.4GHz RC Quad is super fun.
customer_reviews.text: Hubsan X4 (H107C) 4 Channel 2.4GHz RC Quad...We bought this as a Christmas gift for our son, and he loves it. He's still learning how to fly the little bugger. He's having a big ball playing with it while he learns how to go up, down, and around. I would recommend this for anyone who is old enough to have these types of toy's.
customer_reviews.author: Synergyangel

customer_reviews.title: Drone
customer_reviews.text: My 35 yr old son loved getting it as a birthday gift. Reasonably priced, good quality & easy to understand instructions.
customer_reviews.author: JeoFlynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. Great Price. Lately, I've been wanting to get into flying drones as a hobby, but it seemed like there was a hefty barrier to entry because of how expensive drones are. I read that the Hubsan X4 is the perfect way to get started because it's a great product but you don't have to worry if you break it. Flying it is a ton of fun and what I read is true about this being a great way to get into flying drones as a hobby. I might buy another one so I can race them around the house. The price makes the Hubsan X4 a purchase with no down side. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty happy with the quality of the videos
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a blast with my quad copter. This is my first quad. I've crashed several times. It comes with an extra set of propellers and I purchased several more. I've only destroyed two propellers. I'm pretty happy with the quality of the videos. Overall, I think this is a great first quad.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bouthillier

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little quadcopter
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It has crashed many times, a few times from max altitude and it has survived it all, incredibly! Takes decent video, but it is fairly shaky. From such a small lens and quadcopter body, you can't expect more though. Excellent product for the money, this is a great trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Vance

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a little while ago, it works great and worth every penny of the purchase price! Recommend to everyone and you can learn how to fly it on U-tube. Be carful of buying bigger batteries as some of the large capacity ones will not fit as they are too wide. Way to go Hubsan!
customer_reviews.author: R. L. B.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great starter quad WITH a camera
customer_reviews.text: In short, I only flew the mini cx10 drones up until this point. This is a great starter quad WITH a camera! Not the perfect HD quality you see on your smart phones, but it gives you an idea on how to fly a larger craft. If you are interested in flying a drone, get this. Price per value cannot be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I love this copter..
customer_reviews.text: I love this copter.. Great price for what you get. Flies very good, responsive. Only quam is that in expert mode it just likes doing flips a little to much, You have to be on your game if you want the speed because to switch direction you will do a flip.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this the best flying machine but it is a very good price fly's great it works well but the customer service that the seller does is fantasic they will work with you if you have any problems with they will do all they can to help you so if your thinking of buying one honestly buy it from this seller
customer_reviews.author: kenneth campbell

product_meta.title: Hubsan X4 (H107C) 4 Channel 2.4GHz RC Quad Copter with Camera - Red/Black, Red/Black (Discontinued by manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Latest 6-axis flight control system with adjustable gyro sensitivity. Very easy to fly novice to expert. Can charge through USB from your computer. Completely pre-assembled, no construction required. Fun straight out of the box. Includes 4-channel digital proportional rc system. Get off the computer and in the air.
feature_bullets: Latest 6-axis flight control system with adjustable gyro sensitivity
Permits super stable flight. With 4 channels
Camera: 0.3 MP video recording module included (requires a Micro SDHC card)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars1,350 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
